intro: Ligustridium, commonly known as privet, is a genus of flowering plants in the Oleaceae family. It includes shrubs and small trees that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. They produce small, fragrant flowers in clusters, often followed by small, dark berries. Ligustridium species are often used in landscaping due to their adaptability and ornamental value.
